page.title: 05 THE MOUNTS SWIMMING BATHS
page.content: In 1935 the Mounts Swimming Baths was built on the site where the old prison once stood. The outside appearance of the building has hardly changed at all, but the inside of the baths has been considerably altered since it was first built, especially in the changing rooms and locker area. The baths supply a numbr of activities during the week, and probably the most unusual of these is the scuba diving which is held on Thursday evenings. There are swimming lessons in progress every night of the week and these range from Beginners' lessons to advanced diving and swimming coaching. The baths are open every day of the week for public use andd there are always lifeguards available. For the very young there is a mother and babies' pool. Another facility recently available is the Health Suite for sauna and massage treatment.
